listing.description: This former ‘Public House’ is nestled in the heart of Ham, close to Petersham and the wonderful amenities in Richmond upon Thames.The current layout includes a very large bar area, three w.C’s, a basement/cellar and to the upper floors we find the ‘shell’ to two 1 bedroom flats, accessed from the side elevation through another door. The bar area could be used as an expansive entertaining space, as it’s exceptionally deep with a kitchen and utility area to the rear of the building. The basement is fully tanked with light and power whilst the sizeable garden is walled and completely secluded. Other benefits include, gas central heating and vacant possession.This property sits on a desirable corner-plot and would benefit from change-of-use and planning applications, to suit the needs of any buyer.

There are mainline railway stations providing access to King's Cross and Liverpool Street at Cambridge, Whittlesford and Audley End.

listing.description: Property DescriptionA stunning new 4/5 bedroom luxury detached family home with contemporary open plan living situated off Cumnor Hill. Call now to view!Property DetailsProperty Information:A stunning new build 4/5 bedroom luxury detached family home with contemporary open plan living situated off Cumnor Hill. This light and spacious family home is located on sought after Hurst Rise Road and is being built by Habitares Ltd, a small local development company who specialise in building individual highquality homes. Habitares Ltd have worked with Sylva Group Ltd, an Oxfordshire Company who specialise in highly specified timber frame buildings to produce an energy efficient light and spacious home ideally suited to modern family life and built to the highest standards. 85 Hurst Rise Road is a truly ‘one off’ home on an individual plot in an increasingly sought after location. Overlooking woodland to the rear and with views towards the countryside and city from the first floor rooms, the house has the benefit of being in a quiet residential neighbourhood yet has quick and easy access to central Oxford.Location Information:Hurst Rise Road is situated on Cumnor Hill and extends from Botley Road at the foot of the hill to Arnolds Way. The property is situated close to the top end of the road in an area of mainly detached homes on individual plots. Cumnor Hill is a popular and well established residential area as it benefits from good facilities and has access to Oxford and beyond via the A34 and Oxford Ring Road. There are frequent regular bus services to Oxford city centre and Oxford mainline station with rail services to London (Paddington and Marylebone) and Birmingham.Local facilities include good state primary and secondary schools and there are a number of local private schools, at both primary and secondary level, nearby. Other facilities include gp surgeries, dentists, a public library and local shopping facilities in Botley. The local shopping centre is currently being extensively redeveloped to provide new and improved facilities, a new Marks and Spencer food hall is currently under construction nearby and Waitrose have recently opened a new store on Botley Road.Reservation:If you are interested to secure the property, please speak to us about making a holding reservation

listing.description: The Milking Parlour is a mostly new build property enjoying a fabulous vaulted reception room with delightful out look over its own private gardens and fields beyond. Internally there are 4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms.Tigbourne Farm comprises the redevelopment of a 14th Century farmhouse and three 16th to 18th Century barns as well as three early 20th Century dairy barns.All barns have high floor to ceiling heights some reaching over 6 metres. Our client has meticulously undertaken the work, both internally and externally, even to the degree of some beautifully built bargate stone walls, strategic outside cathedral floor lighting and copper roof coverings and cast iron guttering. The ancient barns now feature exposed original timbers, many high ceilings, oak and York stone floors, in addition to oak doors and windows. Each property has its own bespoke kitchen and is complemented by beautifully finished bathrooms and shower rooms. The early 20th Century Calving and Milking Parlours have been carefully built focused around the extensive oak structure with their vaulted ceilings in the reception rooms and a wonderful outlook to the south across farmland. Some properties have their own garage, whilst others have a substantial store.Tigbourne Farm is situated on the northern side of Chiddingfold within 0.6 miles of Witley Station. Witley Village offers the nearest day to day facilities including its general stores and two public houses. The picturesque village centre of Chiddingfold is within 1.8 miles, based around a village green having a range of shops including a post office, general stores, traditional butcher and three public houses. The village benefits from a well-regarded primary school as well as an active community centre with a village hall, doctor’s surgery and various sports clubs.

listing.description: A brand new individual three storey character house part of an exclusive town centre redevelopement of just four luxury homes by Meteor Chapel Developments. Situated in a highly convenient location in the town, very close to Waitrose and within a few hundred yards of both the High Street and Station. Finished to a very high specification with luxury kitchen & bathrooms, and many features including underfloor heating to kitchen & bathrooms, gas c.H. Smart lighting system, air filtration system, fitted carpets, landscaped gardens, 10 year guarantee.LocationLocated within a few hundred yards from the High Street, with its array of bustling individual shops, cafes and restaurants including Tom Kerridge's 2 Michelin Star 'Hand & Flowers' and recently opened 'The Ivy Marlow Garden'. Marlow Station is under ½ mile (London Paddington via Maidenhead with Cross Rail due in 2019) and the Marlow Business Park just over 1 mile. The Marlow bypass A404 is under two miles with direct routes to the M40 at J4 High Wycombe and the M4 at 8/9 Maidenhead. Local recreational facilities include, golf at Temple & Harleyford, walking, cycling and riding in the Hambleden Valley, rowing at the Marlow Rowing Club, . Clubs for tennis, hockey, cricket and bowls can be found in Pound Lane, as well as the Court Garden Leisure Complex, and the National Sports Centre at Bisham Abbey.DirectionsFrom the centre of Marlow, proceed east from the obelisk at the top of the High Street along Spittal Street towards Bourne End. Cross the mini roundabout into Chapel Street, pass the Waitrose store on the right hand side and 'The Corner House' will be found on the right hand side on the corner of Claremont Gardens.

listing.description: Purchasing this property with A lifetime leaseThis property is offered at a reduced price for people aged over 60 through Homewise´s Home for Life Plan. Through the Home for Life Plan, anyone aged over sixty can purchase a lifetime lease on this property which discounts the price from its full market value. The size of the discount you are entitled to depends on your age, personal circumstances and property criteria and could be anywhere between 8.5% and 59% from the property´s full market value. The above price is for guidance only. It is based on our average discount and would be the estimated price payable by a 69-year-old single male. As such, the price you would pay could be higher or lower than this figure.For more information or a personalised quote, just give us a call. Alternatively, if you are under 60 or would like to purchase this property without a Home for Life Plan at its full market price of £1,500,000, please contact Douglas Allen.Property descriptionPriests Lane has always been one of the most highly regarded residential roads within the local area, offering excellent access to the popular Brentwood Private School as well as the option of either Brentwood and Shenfield High Streets and their respective mainline train stations. This property is perfectly located for a family who are fully submerged in the local lifestyle.Welcoming you with its gated front drive, you have the luxury of off-street parking for multiple vehicles as well as access to its detached double garage.The property itself has everything that you would expect from an established family home. The ground floor offers multiple living spaces so that there is room for all of the family to relax and unwind. The property's large lounge with bi-fold doors out onto the garden is a real highlight as this provides the perfect space to entertain all year round. As you explore the garden you will come across a detached outbuilding which is currently being used as the property's gymnasium with hot tub and integrated pool.On the first floor of this property you currently have five excellent sized bedrooms. One of these bedrooms, however, is currently being used as living space. With two en-suites and a further family bathroom, there is always space to get ready for the day ahead. This property is simply perfect for the established family who are looking to move straight in and enjoy the benefits straight away.What the Owner says:We purchased this property twelve years ago as it placed us perfectly for Brentwood school which our son was attending. Since living here we have carried out an extensive redevelopment, extending the property to both sides to create the property that you see today.This property for us has always been the perfect space to enjoy time with our family and friends but also providing a base for the extensive local amenities.Room sizes:Entrance HallStudy 13'2 x 9'6 (4.02m x 2.90m)Lounge 24'0 x 22'6 (7.32m x 6.86m)CloakroomKitchen 17'6 x 14'6 (5.34m x 4.42m)Utility Room 11'2 x 7'8 (3.41m x 2.34m)Snug 16'3 x 12'6 (4.96m x 3.81m)LandingBedroom 1 15'9 x 12'5 (4.80m x 3.79m)En-suiteBedroom 2 24'8 x 12'1 (7.52m x 3.69m)En-suiteBedroom 3 11'7 x 10'9 (3.53m x 3.28m)Bedroom 4 23'8 x 9'3 (7.22m x 2.82m)Bedroom 5 10'3 x 8'9 (3.13m x 2.67m)BathroomDrivewayDouble GarageRear GardenOuthouse with Pool and Hot TubGymnasiumThe information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: The location  Sweetcroft Lane is a premier residential road within close proximity of highly regarded schools, and within easy reach of Hillingdon station that provides Metropolitan and Piccadilly line services to London. Uxbridge town centre is also close by with its vast array of leisure, transport and shopping facilities. For the motorist the A40/M40 is a short drive away giving access to London and the M25. Highly acclaimed local schools to include; St Helen's, St Bernadette's, acs International and Bishopshalt are close by.Outside  The property is set back off of Sweetcroft Lane and is approached via a large private driveway which offers multiple off street parking for around ten vehicles. There is access to a larger than average two car garage/workshop which has been built with future annex/accommodation in mind including central heating and bi-fold doors. To the rear there is a large paved patio overlooking a superb south facing lawn measuring in excess of 150ft.The property  From the front door there is a large entrance hall with doors to all rooms which include kitchen/breakfast room, utility room with door to a large integral garage which has built with heating and bi-fold doors so can be easily converted to a living space. There are doors to a family bathroom and all three double bedrooms with the master bedroom having an en-suite bathroom. The lounge is a good size with two large French doors to the side and rear patios.Details of sale  Freehold saleHillingdon boroughCouncil tax band D

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: A detached family house, with attractive tile hung elevations, providing well proportioned accommodation with scope for some modernisation.Notable features are the triple aspect sitting room with French doors to the garden, the dining hall leading to the open plan kitchen and conservatory, which overlooks the garden.In addition to the 4 bedrooms to the first floor, is a very useful annexe room behind the garage, which could have several uses and overlooks the garden again.Overall, an opportunity to purchase a good family house with scope for general improvement or redevelopment (subject to planning consent) and recommended for its generous garden and location between Chobham and Weybridge.SituationChobham village offers a good selection of local facilities including convenience stores, restaurants and pubs. The area offers good leisure facilities including some of the finest golf clubs in the world, such as Wentworth, Sunningdale and Queenswood, horse racing at Ascot and Windsor, polo at Ascot and the Guards Club.Commuter road and rail links are excellent with Woking mainline station about 4 miles away with frequent direct trains to Waterloo (approx 27 mins)Junction 3 of the M3 is 4 miles away, Junc. 11 of the M25 2.5 miles, Terminal 5 at Heathrow 15 miles and central London 32 miles.There is also a good selection of both state and private schools including Hall Grove, Coworth Park, St Marys, The Marist, St Georges, Eton, acs and tasis.OutsideApproached down a no through lane and via double wooden gates, the property offers good parking in front of the double garage, with lawns forming most of the garden, with mature trees and shrubs. There is a rose arbour down the side of the garage and a paved terrace to one end of the house.Within the garden are 3 stables and a separate garage, as well as a separate access to the main road.In all, the gardens extend to 0.88 acre.
listing.short_description: A delightful, character house with scope for general improvement or development, complemented by a generous garden of 0.88 acre with the benefit of stables, 3 garages, an office/playroom behind the garage, a gated entrance and additional access.

listing.description: DescriptionStunning barn conversion, originally built in 1894 for the Rothschild family, redeveloped in 1998, to offer a combination of contemporary design, whilst retaining a wealth of character situated within the exclusive Home Farm development a short walk from Tring's town centre. The property benefits from a number of character features including exposed timbers, a fireplace, oak flooring and vaulted ceilings. The ground floor comprises an entrance hall, cloakroon vaulted ceiling sitting room with fireplace, dining room, kitchen/breakfast room and a family room. On the first floor a master bedroom with an ensuite, three further bedrooms a spacious gallied landing and a family bathroom.Externally, to the front of the property there is an attractive well stocked garden with driveway parking for several vehicles. To the rear there is a private enclosed garden with a patio seating area extending to a level lawn all enclosed by a brick retaining wall with gated side access.SituationThe historic small market town of Tring is surrounded by beautiful Chilterns countryside just a few miles away from routes providing excellent access to London. Tring town centre provides a range of small specialist shops, restaurants and public houses. Excellent schooling is available for all ages, including independent schools such as The Tring Park School for Performing Arts and the renowned Berkhamsted School. Communications are superb with access to the A41 (providing a direct link to the M25 J20) and from there the national motorway network. Tring main line station provides a fast and frequent service in to London Euston from 36 minutes.Generallocal authorityDacorum Borough Council.ViewingBy appointment with Cesare & Co, 48 High Street, Tring, Hertfordshire, HP23 5AG.Important noticeAlthough these particulars, together with any photographs and/or any floor plans, are intended to give a fair description of the property, they do not constitute any offer or any part of a Contract. Any appliances and/or services mentioned within these particulars have not been tested or verified by the Agent. All negotiations should be conducted through Cesare & Co.NoticePlease note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Purchasers must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

Once you have found a suitable property you will need to place a holding deposit. This is £300 plus £50 for each additional tenant. If the landlord pulls out of the let you will get this money back. If you pull out of the let or fail our referencing criteria you will not get this money back. This figure is deducted from the monies you pay on move-in.
Agency fees including referencing are :- £150.00 + VAT (£180.00 including VAT) for 1 tenant £250.00 + VAT (£300.00 including VAT) for 2 tenants £350.00 + VAT (£420.00 including VAT) for 3 tenants £450.00 + VAT (£540.00 including VAT) for 4 tenants Rising by £50 plus VAT (£60.00 including VAT) thereafter. On vacating the property a fee of £50.00 +VAT (£60.00 including VAT) per person is charged to cover administration costs, check out Inspection and the provision of references to your new Agent / landlord.
If you are a Student or anyone else requiring a Guarantor then the referencing fees are £180 plus VAT (£216.00 including VAT) as both you and the guarantor are referenced.
Once your / your guarantors forms are approved the move in date can be confirmed.
On move in day you will need to: Pay 6 weeks of the rent as your deposit Pay one months rent in advance Pay for your referencing Each bring in your passport/drivers license as valid photo id We deduct the initial holding deposit at this point. Payment of these charges can be made as follows:
Bankers Draft made payable to knight & knoxley
Cash - £20.00 handling fee applies.
Cheques made payable to knight & knoxley – presented 10 working days before the move in date.
Direct Transfer to our account. Bacs payments take 4 working days, chaps payments to be made no later than 48 hours before move in.
Note that once moved in, a standing order should be set up to pay the monthly rent, and for multi-occupancy properties, the rent should come from one account only. You must put the property address as a reference.
listing.description: DescriptionCall knight & knoxley For AppointmentsAn exceptional and substantial semi-detached period house moments from Preston Park in a highly desirable and sought after location. This grand family home with six double bedrooms and three bathrooms has stunning Victorian features, original fireplaces and intricate cornicing. This family home has been lovingly restored by the present owners and offers over 2,000 square feet of versatile living accommodation throughout.Enter into spacious hallways with original staircase. Front facing reception features ornate fireplace, original wooden flooring, ornate cornicing and double glazed front facing windows. Follow the hallway through to contemporary kitchen/dining space with has bi-fold doors leading to elevated landscaped garden with built in seating area. Fitted kitchen with integrated appliances, island with electric hob, plenty of storage and spot lighting. The garden space has been designed to maximise space and is private and peaceful, perfect for entertaining or relaxing on sunny daysFirst bedroom is located on the ground floor and is spacious in size and has bay sash window overlooking the garden. There is also an under stairs shower room with sash window.Upstairs to first floor with four good sized double bedrooms and family bathroom with fitted bath, white washed wooden flooring and window to the front. The master bedroom is located to the front of the house and features double glazed windows. Upstairs again to fantastic loft conversion which is used as the fifth bedroom with boutique style en-suite walk-in shower room.The property is moments from the open spaces of Preston Park and close to the recently redeveloped Open Market and London Road/Preston Circus area which offer numerous restaurants and a vibrant foodie scene. The famous Brighton Laines & beach are within walking distance. Artist open houses run through the spring months along with summer fairs and street parties in Blaker's park, Preston park and surrounding streets. Looking for an evening out? The Duke Of York's Picture house is one of the best in the UK along with great local pubs serving good food (try the Park View & Preston Park Tavern). Excellent local shops including Arkwright's delicatessen and Moe's at The Circus serving the best coffee and scrumptious things. Preston Park station is close by with a direct link to Victoria accessible in less than one hour, perfect for commuters. Further good transport links directly to London from Brighton mainline station. The property is located in a highly sought after area and in the catchment for numerous renowned schools with excellent Ofsted ratings.

listing.description: An exceptional five bedroom mews house situated on a quiet cobbled lane in the centre of Camden Town. This fantastic property offers approximately 1236 sq ft of bright and spacious living space spread across three floors. The ground floor hosts dual aspect reception room & modern fully fitted open plan kitchen (circa 24'6 ft), the first floor benefits from three double bedrooms with a shower room and guest cloakroom. The second floor boasts a generous principle bedroom, a further double bedroom and a modern family bathroom. Kings Terrace conveniently runs parallel to Camden High Street and is moments from the town's eclectic charm offering an array of independent shops, street markets & music venues. Mornington Crescent is 0.2 miles away (Northern Line) and Camden Road Station 0.5 miles (London Overground Line), furthermore there are several bus routes connecting you all over London. The rapidly evolving redevelopment of Kings Cross and St Pancras is 0.6 miles away, offering a further choice of stylish shops and quality retail, alongside the popular recreational squares and arts centre. These stations are served by six underground lines, connecting you to other popular central London destinations within minutes. Despite the urban feel and proximity to the City, nearby green open spaces at Regent's Park and Primrose Hill are close by (0.5 miles).

listing.description: Located in a rural area in Medstead, this large detached property with a self contained annexe sits centrally in a plot of over half an acre. Externally there is a large front garden with a wooden framed cart house for parking of 3 cars and a shingle driveway with parking space for an additional 3 family cars. The front garden is bordered by hedgerow and a number of mature trees, shrubs and plants. The side garden is currently used by the current owners as an area for growing fruit and vegetables and lends itself well to this use. The rear garden is screened from the farm land beyond by mature evergreen trees and hedgerow. There is a large workshop/summer house offering the opportunity for a variety of uses, possibly a great spot for a summer house, with bar and pizza oven an outside office or a home gym. There is a pergola with feature pond in the centre and large greenhouse (that would benefit from upgrading). The rest of the space is given over to well tended lawn with the rear of the house enclosed by decking and overhead trellis. This garden is an incredible space, perfect for family time on a sunny afternoon or hosting friends for a bbq.Internally everything about this property is impressive in terms of its size and finish.The front door opens into a wide, bright and welcoming Entrance Lobby. The kitchen to the right has many bright white cupboards ensuring all the space you will ever need for kitchen storage, Dark floor and worktops offset the white cupboards and the built in ovens and separate gas hob add both style and practicality to the space. To the rear of the kitchen an arch leads into a sitting/breakfast area. With doors opening out onto the rear garden this is a great area for enjoying a coffee and some cake or reading a book whilst watching the birds in the garden beyond. To the left is a more formal dining room, with two windows providing views out over the rear garden.There are three further living spaces in the main house on the ground floor. At the end of the entrance hall the space opens up to create a lovely vestibule and provides the perfect area for a study or music/reading room. The living room and conservatory extend from the end of the property to the south east. The spacious living room is over 18ft by 14ft with a fireplace on the southern wall providing a lovely feature as well as winter warmth.A glazed door provides direct access onto the patio. This is a wonderful social space where families and friends can come together and make memories. Through the rear of the lounge a single door leads into a large and bright conservatory. A real sun trap, this large room is great as an additional living space to enjoy throughout the year or as somewhere to grow a wide variety of botanical delights.The ground floor also contains 2 of the main house's 5 bedrooms. There is a large double room with two built in wardrobes and a great en suite. The second room is a uniquely shaped single that makes a perfect kids room with room to sleep, room to play and room to hide from Mum and Dad! The ground floor is completed by a good size family cloakroom and a galley style utility room with countertop workspace, storage and room for washing machine, tumble dryer and additional fridge freezer if required.Upstairs the roof space has been brilliantly converted to house three further bedrooms and two bathrooms. There are two very light spacious doubles at either end of the long hallway. The double to the right hand side has 2 large built in wardrobes to maximise storage space and a good size modern en suite with full size bath, thus making this room the perfect Master Suite. There is a further bedroom along with another large family bathroom with separate bath and walk in shower.There is a more recent addition of a spacious self contained 1 bedroom annexe on the eastern end of the property which can be accessed from the main house. The annexe enjoys its own entrance hall with large storage cupboards and cloakroom. The L shaped living/dining room is designed to ensure you have all the space needed for sofas, tv's, sideboards and dining tables. The galley style kitchen, with its own door to the garden, is large enough for a 3 bedroom family home and its new cupboards and appliances provide a classic look. There is a large double bedroom with built in wardrobe, separate airing cupboard and bathroom with walk in shower. This is a fantastic additional space that offers many options for multi generational living within one property. A great space for an older couple; it would also suit younger adults looking for independent living.Due to its size and location next to similar developments this plot offers the opportunity of redevelopment subject to planning to hold 3 family homes with a total sale price of between £2.2m and £2.4m.This home includes:Kitchen3.9m x 3.62m (14.1 sqm) - 12' 9" x 11' 10" (151 sqft)Kitchen / Breakfast Room3.22m x 2.7m (8.6 sqm) - 10' 6" x 8' 10" (93 sqft)Dining Room3.49m x 3.22m (11.2 sqm) - 11' 5" x 10' 6" (120 sqft)Study3.82m x 2.83m (10.8 sqm) - 12' 6" x 9' 3" (116 sqft)Living Room5.62m x 4.28m (24 sqm) - 18' 5" x 14' (258 sqft)Conservatory4.69m x 4.28m (20 sqm) - 15' 4" x 14' (216 sqft)Utility Room2.95m x 1.97m (5.8 sqm) - 9' 8" x 6' 5" (62 sqft)Bedroom5.15m x 2.95m (15.1 sqm) - 16' 10" x 9' 8" (163 sqft)Bedroom4.63m x 4.29m (19.8 sqm) - 15' 2" x 14' (213 sqft)Bedroom5.12m x 4.07m (20.8 sqm) - 16' 9" x 13' 4" (224 sqft)Bedroom4.63m x 4.07m (18.8 sqm) - 15' 2" x 13' 4" (202 sqft)Bedroom3.21m x 2.6m (8.3 sqm) - 10' 6" x 8' 6" (89 sqft)Bathroom3.5m x 2.6m (9.1 sqm) - 11' 5" x 8' 6" (97 sqft)Living/Dining Room6.79m x 2.92m (19.8 sqm) - 22' 3" x 9' 6" (213 sqft)AnnexeKitchen4.2m x 2.65m (11.1 sqm) - 13' 9" x 8' 8" (119 sqft)AnnexeBedroom4.13m x 2.85m (11.7 sqm) - 13' 6" x 9' 4" (127 sqft)AnnexeEnsuite2.97m x 1.56m (4.6 sqm) - 9' 8" x 5' 1" (49 sqft)AnnexeEntrance Hall2.29m x 1.87m (4.2 sqm) - 7' 6" x 6' 1" (46 sqft)AnnexeWC0.97m x 2.11m (2 sqm) - 3' 2" x 6' 11" (22 sqft)AnnexePlease note, all dimensions are approximate / maximums and should not be relied upon for the purposes of floor coverings.Additional Information:Detached BungalowSeparate 1 Bedroom Annexe6 Bedrooms, 6 BathroomsPlot of Over 0.5 AcreMature GardensCouncil Tax: Band FEnergy Performance Certificate (EPC) Rating:Band D (55-68)A unique and wonderful property set on a large plot in a highly desirable area. Offering extensive internal accommodation for distinguished family living this property needs to be seen to be really understood and appreciated.Marketed by EweMove Sales & Lettings (Alton & Bordon) - Property Reference 22873

listing.description: A charming and perfectly formed Two-Three bedroom detached early 1850’s cottage, tucked-away just off Kentish Town Road. Arranged over three-storeys, the accommodation (930 Sq.Ft.) comprises on raised ground floor: A generous entrance hallway adjacent a bright and attractive living room with high ceilings (or a potential third bedroom) and a modern family bathroom. The original staircase with wrought iron banister leads downstairs to the semi open-plan kitchen and dining room, which can also be used as reception area on the lower ground floor. The dining room houses a working log burner and characterful exposed brick work. Access to the private courtyard garden and shed from the connecting staircase.The top floor has two well-proportioned bedrooms, both with ample built-in storage and an abundance of natural daylight, completed by a roof light above the stairwell providing access to the rooftop. Additional features include: Double glazed sash windows throughout, with a new roof installed in 2016 and the property having the potential to be extended to another level, under the necessary planning consents.Farrier Street is one the most convenient locations within Camden, set just north of the vibrant market redevelopment and Kentish Town with easy access to the multiple amenities such as Victorian swimming baths, Underground and Over-ground stations, local shops on the High Street along with easy access to Collège Français Bilingue de Londres on Holmes Road, Camden School for Girls & Hawley infantsSurrounded by a wonderful selection of transport facilities, from local bus routes to the City and West End. Northern Line underground stations at Camden and Kentish Town, local rail services from Camden Road or Kentish Town West to East London and the international hubs for the Eurostar and Luton and Gatwick airports. Beautifully appointed local parks are on your door step such as; Primrose Hill and Regents Park as well as Hampstead Heath. To Be Sold Chain Free.LocationReception 1KitchenBedroom 1BathroomReception/Third Bedroom

listing.description: The Dutch barn is delightful 4 bedroom and 3 bathroom barn conversion in this superb rural hamlet.Tigbourne Farm comprises the redevelopment of a 14th Century farmhouse and three 16th to 18th Century barns as well as three early 20th Century dairy barns.All barns have high floor to ceiling heights some reaching over 6 metres. Our client has meticulously undertaken the work, both internally and externally, even to the degree of some beautifully built bargate stone walls, strategic outside cathedral floor lighting and copper roof coverings and cast iron guttering. The ancient barns now feature exposed original timbers, many high ceilings, oak and York stone floors, in addition to oak doors and windows. Each property has its own bespoke kitchen and is complemented by beautifully finished bathrooms and shower rooms. The early 20th Century Calving and Milking Parlours have been carefully built focused around the extensive oak structure with their vaulted ceilings in the reception rooms and a wonderful outlook to the south across farmland. Some properties have their own garage, whilst others have a substantial store.Tigbourne Farm is situated on the northern side of Chiddingfold within 0.6 miles of Witley Station. Witley Village offers the nearest day to day facilities including its general stores and two public houses. The picturesque village centre of Chiddingfold is within 1.8 miles, based around a village green having a range of shops including a post office, general stores, traditional butcher and three public houses. The village benefits from a well-regarded primary school as well as an active community centre with a village hall, doctor’s surgery and various sports clubs.

listing.description: A classic, calm and stylish period terrace of three double bedrooms, two receptions, a large kitchen diner and magnificent garden.Both receptions have elegant high ceilings with theoriginal cornicing, stripped flooring and contemporary decor, with the rear being the 'snug' thanks to the cosy fireplaceand french doors to the garden, making it nice and breezy in thesummer. Down the hallway and you're into the heart of the house:What a fabulous family and entertaining space this is! Lots ofdining space thanks to the bay windows to the side and the kitchen is fully fitted with solid timber worktops and room for the range cooker and usual appliances. Access to the garden from here too, more of which later.Up the stairs to the master bedroom, nice and big, double glazedand lots of light. Behind is bedroom two, a good double andtranquility personified. Down to the rear landing where you'll find the bright, contemporary bathroom, and behind this is the third bedroom, a great sized double perfect for kids, guests or a home office, and the rear loft access is a handy storage space.You've also got the main loft space for tons more storage or possible expansion subject to the usual permissions.Now then, this garden - it's huge, by London standards, and it'sSouth-West aspect means plenty of sun. Exit the kitchen straight onto the patio for those summer BBQs, then next up is the generous lawn space. A visit to the Nunhead Gardener up the road is a must - a fantastic garden centre for the green fingered amongst us, and so close too.Gellatly Rd lies at the south west corner of Telegraph Hill, and is so well connected for transport. Nunhead is direct to Victoria, Blackfriars and E&C, while both London Bridge and the Ginger line are accessible from Queens Road Peckham and New Cross Gate.Families have a choice of local school options, with Edmund Wallerand Hollydale Primaries and Aske's Secondary & Free school allnearby.Nunhead Lane is just around the corner, and is fast becoming the trendy local shopping area, with an array of independent and artisan shops including an amazing fishmonger, bakers, butchers, craft beer shop and cafes - very 'villagey'.There's also a recently redeveloped kids play area on Nunhead Green.Telegraph Hill is home to the two brilliant parks, with fabulouscityscape views, tennis courts and picnic area in the top park, andthe skate park, toddlers play area, ponds etc in the lower. There'salso the Hill Station Community Cafe, which plays host to lots of pop events and restaurants.
listing.short_description: Period Terrace I Three Double Bedrooms I Two Receptions I Large Kitchen Diner I Cellar I Huge sw Facing Garden I Telegraph Hill Conservation Area I 1346Sqf / 125 Sqm I Excellent Transport & School Options

listing.description: A stunning & unique 4 bedroom barn offering an abundance of character in a tranquil country setting, just a short walk from Bourne Valley Garden Centre & Restaurant and The Cricketers Pub. Tucked away at the very end of Woodham on the cusp of Greenbelt is a tiny hamlet of just four barns with gated access, redeveloped in 2008 by Ashfronts Bespoke Homes, with much use of reclaimed materials and vaulted ceilings.An imposing hallway is flooded with light from the triple glass panes to the front entrance, oak floor and turning oak staircase. There is a tiled cloakroom and family room/study, again with triple glass panes to the rear garden, recess storage and coat cupboard. A glorious 22ft living room is dominated by a brick built fireplace, dual aspect windows and French garden doors. A charming country kitchen with butler sink, Quartz worktop & breakfast bar enjoys a vaulted ceiling with exposed beams, garden views, integrated Miele oven & grill. A utility room with garden door houses 'Valliant' boiler, consumer unit, meter cupboard, water softener with space for washer/dryer.Even the upstairs landing enjoys a valued ceiling with clever storage above the entrance to the Master Suite; a dual aspect bedroom with fabulous height & exposed beams, triple fitted wood wardrobes & tasteful tiled en suite shower with Velux window & extractor fan. A stunning, symmetrical Bedroom Two enjoys garden views with a wall of double glazed windows to the floor. Bedroom Three makes full use of the dramatic pitch roof, as does Bedroom Four with mezzanine bed - a child's dream! A beautifully fitted white family bathroom suite has tiled walls, the same dramatic pitch & Velux window.Outside is a private West facing rear garden with pretty dining patio, lawn with a variety of shrub & plant borders, 'sleeper' vegetable patches, a gravel drive for numerous vehicles and private gated access. There is an attractive garage block inside the main walled entrance to Rodwell Barns.

listing.description: Quietly situated on one of Finchampstead's most sought after locations sits this immaculately presented and excellent sized detached family property. This wonderful home is placed on a sizeable plot of just over half an acre and offers excellent potential to extend / redevelop subject to the relevant planning permissions. The current owners have lovingly cared for the property and it features a bright and airy 23'11 x 19' dual aspect living / dining room, two further reception rooms, modern fitted kitchen with high quality built in appliances, separate utility room / cloakroom whilst the first floor boasts four bedrooms with family bathroom and en suite shower to the master bedroom. Externally, the property offers a large gravelled driveway to the front providing ample off street parking for numerous vehicles, a tandem garage and a vast rear garden enclosed with post and rail fencing. Heath Ride is a sought after private lane in Finchampstead offering good access into the village with its array of shops and restaurants as well as schools and doctors surgery. It is also contiguous with National Trust land so offers excellent walks and trails. The area is served by excellent road links to the M3 / M4 / A33/ A329 road networks as well as offering good train connections into London. Viewings are highly advised to avoid missing out.

listing.description: The Coach House is a delightful family home offering versatile accommodation of approximately 2200 square feet. Being recently redeveloped by the current owners this stunning three bedroom home offers flexible and spacious living space to the ground floor.The open plan kitchen/dining room is a comfortable and welcoming entertaining space. Boasting an amazing bespoke kitchen, contemporary cream base units and a central island with feature down lighters and the addition of many modern features including a Smeg range, fitted wine fridge, an American fridge freezer and wooden flooring that runs throughout the ground floor. Double doors lead into the main reception space, with a stunning brick built open fireplace making an attractive and welcoming focal point to the room. Glazed double doors lead out onto the gardens and patio area allowing outdoor entertaining through the summer months.The first floor has three bedrooms all with their own ensuites. The master has the addition of buiilt-in wardrobes.SituationThe village of Seal has an excellent primary school and a small range of local shopping facilities including a butcher, delicatessen and newsagent. Close by is Knole Park, 1,000 acres of parkland and one of the last remaining medieval deer parks.Nearby Sevenoaks offers a comprehensive range of educational, recreational and shopping facilities, together with a mainline station with services to London Cannon Street/Charing Cross in approximately 30/35 minutes. There are a good selection of highly regarded state and private schools.The A21 is easily accessible linking with the M25 and other motorway networks, Gatwick, Heathrow, Stansted and City Airports, Bluewater Shopping Centre, the Channel Tunnel and both Ebbsfleet and Ashford InterStations.NationOutsideThis property features a private garden features a paved patio area that is shaded by a wooden gazebo and is the perfect place for entertaining through out the summer months. With the addition of several fruit trees the garden has on open outlook onto the fields beyond.Set within 15 acres of landscaped communal gardens that afford plenty of walking opportunities as well a providing an open outlook across the North Downs. This property has two allocated parking spaces as well as plenty of opportunities for guest parking and an electric car charging point.

listing.description: Situation: Polly’s Cottage is situated in a beautiful rural location at the end of a shared private farm track in the High Weald of East Sussex designated as an area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.The property is approximately two miles from the historic village of Mayfield with its picturesque High Street, which offers an excellent range of amenities including a general store with post office, butcher, baker, pharmacy, florist, greengrocers and deli as well as doctors’ surgery, dentist and hairdressers. There are also cafes and period Inns, including the renowned Middle House, as well as pretty churches, a primary school and the well regarded independent school for girls, Mayfield School.The regional centre of Tunbridge Wells is approximately 8 miles distant to the north and provides a comprehensive range of amenities including the Royal Victoria Shopping centre, cinema complex and theatres.The beautiful surrounding countryside includes Bewl Water Reservoir, reputedly the largest area of inland water in the South East, where a wide range of water sports can be enjoyed.Description: Polly’s Cottage is a detached former farm cottage with external elevations of weatherboard beneath a slate tiled roof. The house has been well maintained and is in good order yet offers excellent scope for further improvement, remodelling or complete redevelopment, if required, subject to the necessary consents.The property enjoys a southerly aspect with large picture windows framing far reaching views over countryside beyond, and benefits from providing spacious accommodation of approximately 2,266sq.Ft. There are mature, well-stocked gardens of about half an acre that wrap around the property on three sides and mixed woodland to the side and rear amounting to approximately 3 acres.The house is set in a private and peaceful position without being isolated and offers accommodation that is light and spacious throughout, with several of the rooms benefiting from being double aspect and enjoying a lovely outlook over the gardens. The accommodation includes five bedrooms (four doubles and single/study bedroom), an ensuite and family bathroom, and a well-proportioned open plan kitchen/sitting/dining room with a fireplace and doors opening out to the gardens.Outside, the property is approached down a private track of 0.6 miles and is set well away from roads amidst farmland and countryside. A gate leads to the property with a parking area for several cars and a garage. The gardens are mainly laid to lawn with a variety of mature shrubs and plants, a south facing terrace to the front with views over adjoining farmland and countryside and a large area of woodland extending to approximately 3 acres in all. The property also benefits from access beyond the driveway to public footpaths and bridleways.Services: Mains water and electricity. Oil-fired central heating. Private drainage.Current EPC Rating: ELocal Authority: Rother District Council Council tax band: F
listing.short_description: A highly individual 5 bedroom former farm cottage of approximately 2,266sq.Ft, situated within two miles of Mayfield village in a wonderful rural position at the end of long track, bordering farm land and enjoying far reaching southerly views over surrounding countryside, as well as offering excellent scope for further improvement, remodelling or complete redevelopment.

listing.description: Denham mainline station 1.4 miles (22 minutes to London Marylebone), Uxbridge town centre 4.1 miles, Gerrards Cross town centre 3.7 miles, M40 (Jct 1) 0.9 miles, Heathrow Airport (Terminal 5) 9.7 miles, Central London approx 18.0 milesThe property represents an exciting opportunity for redevelopment, standing in extensive grounds of approximately 1 3/4 acres, on the same title and within the grounds is a near dilapidated separate dwelling previously known as Moorland with its own access.The Moorings is a three bedroom chalet with two bedrooms on the first floor, it either needs complete modernisation or could potentially be knocked down and replaced with a new property subject to planning consent.EPC Rating: FThe picturesque village of Denham is ideally located for the Thames Valley in South Buckinghamshire, just off the A40 and junction 1 of the M40, near Heathrow and Uxbridge. It is very peaceful with many historic buildings, including the beautiful private houses Denham Court and Denham Place, as well as the 15th century church of St Mary.The village is home to Buckinghamshire Golf Club – a parkland course of 18 holes, crossed by the Rivers Colne and Misbourne, and suitable for all standards. The clubhouse is in the Grade II listed Denham Court Mansion. Walking is popular in the area with a circular walk, the Colne Valley trail and other sign-posted walks on offer. These walks encounter the Grand Union Canal, lakes and the 69 acres Denham Country Park. There are 5 pubs, some serving food, such as The Swan Inn gastro-pub as well as dedicated restaurants Biggles and The Falcon Inn.The property is approached over a pretty private lane adjacent to fields and countryside. A five bar gate affords access to The Moorings which sits in substantial gardens and grounds of 1.73 acres. There are several outbuildings albeit all in need of attention. Attractive countryside views around the property
listing.short_description: A detached three bedroom chalet style bungalow in need of complete renovation and standing in grounds approximately 1.73 acres.

listing.description: The Calving Parlour is a significantly newly built property in this delightful hamlet setting. Internally, the property provides 4 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms and enjoys an outlook over the fields beyond its own private gardens. This property provides the perfect lock up and leave.Tigbourne Farm comprises the redevelopment of a 14th Century farmhouse and three 16th to 18th Century barns as well as three early 20th Century dairy barns.All barns have high floor to ceiling heights some reaching over 6 metres. Our client has meticulously undertaken the work, both internally and externally, even to the degree of some beautifully built bargate stone walls, strategic outside cathedral floor lighting and copper roof coverings and cast iron guttering. The ancient barns now feature exposed original timbers, many high ceilings, oak and York stone floors, in addition to oak doors and windows. Each property has its own bespoke kitchen and is complemented by beautifully finished bathrooms and shower rooms. The early 20th Century Calving and Milking Parlours have been carefully built focused around the extensive oak structure with their vaulted ceilings in the reception rooms and a wonderful outlook to the south across farmland. Some properties have their own garage, whilst others have a substantial store.Tigbourne Farm is situated on the northern side of Chiddingfold within 0.6 miles of Witley Station. Witley Village offers the nearest day to day facilities including its general stores and two public houses. The picturesque village centre of Chiddingfold is within 1.8 miles, based around a village green having a range of shops including a post office, general stores, traditional butcher and three public houses. The village benefits from a well-regarded primary school as well as an active community centre with a village hall, doctor’s surgery and various sports clubs.

listing.description: Situation: The property is situated in a rural position on the outskirts of Rotherfield village, which offers an excellent range of shops and services for everyday needs including a general store, doctors’ surgery, chemist, hairdressers, garage and inns. There is a well-regarded primary school and pre-school and there are also leisure facilities nearby including Dewlands Manor Golf Club, local trout fishing lakes, and excellent walks can be found at the Millennium Green and the surrounding countryside. The village is one of the oldest settlements within the High Weald of Sussex, located in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and as a result is protected under local plans with its beautiful church, dating from 1060, and many other listed buildings of historical and architectural interest.Crowborough is approximately 3½ miles distant and offers good facilities including Waitrose and Morrisons supermarkets and a Tesco and Sainsburys Local can also be found within 2½ miles of the property at Jarvis Brook, as well as a mainline station to London.The regional centre of Tunbridge Wells, which is approximately 6 miles distant, provides a comprehensive range of amenities including the historic Pantiles, Royal Victoria shopping centre, cinema complex, theatres and mainline railway station with services via London Bridge to Cannon Street and Charing Cross.Description: High Meadow is a well presented 1930s cottage, built by the highly regarded Lions Green Building Company, with attractive external elevations of weatherboard beneath a tiled roof and double glazed windows throughout. The property has been well maintained by the current owner over the last 34 years, yet offers excellent scope for some general updating, remodelling and enlargement, or complete redevelopment, if required. The house also benefits from being set on a generous plot of just over an acre with a lovely outlook over its gardens and rural views to the front.The accommodation is arranged over two floors and includes on the ground floor an entrance hall, a cloakroom, a double aspect kitchen/breakfast room, which has a larder cupboard and door leading out to a porch and a boiler room, a dining room, a good-sized double aspect sitting room with a fireplace fitted with a wood burner and a door leading to a double aspect bedroom and wet room (formerly a garden room) with a door leading out to the garden. On the first floor there are four bedrooms (three doubles and a single), with the master bedroom being double aspect and having a shower cubicle, and a family bathroom.Outside, the house is approached through five bar gates to a tarmac driveway providing off road parking for several cars, which leads to a garage with an electric up and over door and plenty of space for utility appliances. There is also an adjacent car port/workshop and a garden/log store.The mature gardens, which surround the house and extend to just over an acre, are a real feature of the property and are mainly laid to lawn with a variety of mature shrubs, plants and trees. There is a greenhouse, a vegetable garden, a good-sized terrace, a pergola clad with roses and a summer house. The garden is dog-proof and bordered by mature hedging with a gate leading onto a public footpath.Current EPC Rating: EServices: Mains water and electricity. Private drainage. Oil-fired central heatingLocal Authority: Wealden District Council
listing.short_description: A very pretty 4 bedroom 1930s Lions Green detached cottage offering excellent scope for enlargement, situated in a lovely rural position on a quiet lane within easy reach of village amenities.

listing.description: Hall Place Lodge was originally the gate house to Hall Place, one of the large, late Victorian gentleman’s houses built along what is now a private residential lane known as Hall Place Drive.Enjoying an attractive location at the entrance of Hall Place Drive, we are delighted to offer for sale this unique and characterful detached Victorian lodge which has been in the same family ownership since the 1950’s. In need of general updating and modernisation, the lodge provides fantastic scope to adapt and enlarge even further, subject to obtaining the appropriate permission and consents. We believe that again subject to gaining the requisite permission there is also scope to completely redevelop the plot on which the lodge sits, potentially with a pair of substantial semi-detached houses.As it stands the property offers some superb period features and architectural details. Having been extended and enlarged several times through our clients ownership, the property now provides charming, rambling accommodation with a multitude of reception rooms and bedrooms which can be used and adapted to suit ones needs. A huge loft area provides even further potential.The property can be access both via the original front entrance which is on Queens Road or via the rear drive and garden which opens into the utility/hall to the rear. The front door sits under a deep canopied porch and opens into a bay windowed entrance hall. This leads through to a good size reception room which in turn gives access to the separate dining room and subsequently the inner hallway. The hallway in turn gives access to the kitchen via a utility/hall, a choice of four bedrooms and the family bathroom which has an adjoining walk-in shower room as well as a separate guest cloakroom.A particularly notable feature of this very attractive property is its good size mature garden which essentially surrounds the house to three sides, accommodates a large detached timber garden office/studio serviced by its own W.C. There is also plenty of private off-street parking.Whilst being very attractive as it currently stands, Hall Place Lodge also offers masses of potential to substantially remodel and enlarge the current accommodation. Potentially a very exciting project that could create a unique and stunning home.

listing.description: Detached rural property situated in a beautiful position surrounded by the Kent countryside and with stunning views from every angle. New Homefield is set within three quarters of an acre on the outskirts of the pretty village of Marsh Green which is a short drive to Edenbridge Town and the mainline train station.• Detached family home• Redevelopment potential (stpc)• Stunning views• Quiet no through lane• Large detached garage• Four bedrooms• Four reception rooms• Sitting room with log burning stove• Beautiful gardens• Enviable location• Excellent selection of schools• Good transport links• A short drive to Edenbridge TownThe current owners have lived in this lovely property for over 65 years increasing the size as their family grew. New Homefield offers many options for someone looking for a property they can make their own and wanting to live in a rural setting whilst having access to good amenities and excellent transport links into London. The original home which dates back to the early 1900’s has been substantially extended to create a large four bedroom house. To the ground floor the property has four receptions rooms, a large kitchen, two double bedrooms a utility room and a cloakroom. On the first floor there are two large double bedrooms and a family bathroom.This property and the plot that it enjoys has so much potential; the existing property can be renovated and re-configured or replaced with a new build. Whatever you choose to do we have no doubt that you will love living in such a beautiful and tranquil setting. Opportunities like this don’t come along very often and viewing this property is strongly advised so that you can appreciate the location.As well as increasing the size of the property the current owners have purchased additional land increasing the total size of the plot to just under an acre and creating beautiful gardens that wrap around their home. To the front and to both sides there is are beautifully manicured lawns with a path leading from the front round the side of the property and into the rear garden. The rear garden overlooks the surrounding countryside and has a large lawn area with a wonderful selection of mature plants, and trees. To the outside there is also a large detached garage, shed, workshop, greenhouses, mature beds, raised borders and herbaceous borders.Services: Mains water, Electricity. Private drainage.Local Authority: Sevenoaks District CouncilCouncil Tax Band: ETenure: FreeholdEdenbridge is a small market town with a medieval high street surrounded by countryside with a selection of shops, banks, pubs, hospital and restaurants. Recreational amenities in the area include a leisure centre with swimming pool, golf courses and a number of local National Trust properties. The town also benefits from two mainline train stations offering services to London in under 45 minutes. The M25 can be easily accessed at either junction 6 (Godstone) or junction 5 (Sevenoaks). Gatwick airport is about 18 miles and the Channel Tunnel about 65 miles allowing easy access to the Continent.M25 Godstone (J6) 10 miles; Oxted 8 miles; East Grinstead 10 miles; Sevenoaks 12 miles; Tunbridge Wells 13 miles

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: Set on a corner plot down a lovely peaceful village lane in Sutton Green a three bedroom detached family home, ideal for downsizers. Positioned in a fabulous location and backing directly onto the village green. Offered to the market with no onward chain.Property DescriptionThe accommodation which is arranged over two floors comprises a spacious double aspect living room with double glazed bi-folding doors to the large bespoke double glazed conservatory which enjoys views over the secluded gardens. There is also a separate dining room, fitted kitchen and downstairs cloakroom on the ground floor. On the first floor there is a family bathroom, three bedrooms, two large double bedrooms and a single. Positioned off one of the larger bedrooms is a study. This could easily be converted to create either an ensuite bathroom or dressing room.The mature gardens offer a wonderful outside space amongst seclusion. A gate provides access to the village green and there is also access to the front. A five bar gate leads to the driveway which benefits from a garage and carport. Internal viewings are highly recommended.LocationSutton Green has a distinct country feel and is a rare find locally, feeling truly pastoral yet not remote and offers a popular public house with a village hall.An extensive range of shopping is found in Guildford around three miles away. Guildford High Street is known within Surrey for its attractive ancient cobbles and pretty shops under the backdrop of the local Downs. There is a House of Fraser and Marks and Spencer and the Tunsgate shopping centre is being redeveloped and will offer further shopping from Autumn 2017.Both Woking and Guildford have excellent rail links to London with Woking being fastest within 25 minutes. The A3 trunk road can be accessed at Burpham around 1.5 miles away and gives a quick link to central London (27 miles) and both Heathrow and Gatwick Airports.

listing.description: Rare rustic charm with fantastic potential!Dating back to around 1780, this charming farmhouse retains much period character and is situated on the edge of Polegate, nestled in approximately an acre of land. Perfect for keeping animals, the lovely grounds surrounding the property incude a flint-walled rose garden, a herb garden, wooded areas and even a pond.The property is situated in a sought after residential area. Local amenities are at nearby Polegate and include local schools, shopping facilities and railway station with services to Gatwick and London Victoria.Although now in need of some improvement, this spacious property offers huge potential for an incredible detached family home. The accommodation briefly comprises large entrance hall, three generous reception rooms with feature fireplaces, an excellent sized bespoke kitchen/dining room, five bedrooms with countryside and downland views, four of which boast from en-suite bathrooms.Perks of the property include a garage, brick built potting shed, mezzanine floor, a cellar, utility room, original inglenook fireplace, large cathedral ceiling kitchen, large natural pond, driveway for multiple cars.Only an inspection will convey its very special appeal! Call Oakfield for more information.(nb The property is offered below market value as the surrounding land has been sold for redevelopment. listing.description: Spacious versatility - This five bedroom detached family home has been refurbished and extended to create flexible accommodation, set in fabulous gardens of over half an acre perfect for entertaining in a pleasant rural location.* Entrance hall * Sitting room * Four bedrooms on the ground floor * Family bathroom * Fitted kitchen/Breakfast room leading into 33ft family room * Feature fireplace * Contemporary finish * Central courtyard * Fourth bedroom with en-suite wet room * First floor bedroom with en-suite bathroom * Double glazing * Garage and storeroom * Large private driveway * Beautiful rear gardens with decked area * Further potential Subject to Planning * Viewing recommended * EPC Rating E *DescriptionThis detached family home has been extended and refurbished to create versatile accommodation throughout alongside a contemporary finish. Set in gardens of over half an acre with further extension possibilities, subject to planning, this will suit those purchasers looking to create a forever family home in a delightful location. The accommodation in brief currently comprises an entrance hall giving access to the sitting room with feature fireplace and large bay window enjoying a front aspect. There are three good size bedrooms within this part of the property and family bathroom complements these rooms. The kitchen/breakfast room has been extended and refitted to provide a lovely contemporary space leading through to a 33ft family reception room which not only gives access to the stunning rear gardens but also a lovely central courtyard which offers a peaceful and tranquil area from which to enjoy this beautiful home. The vendors have recently enhanced this beautiful room further with the addition of a log burner, providing plenty of warmth and a cosy feel throughout the winter months. The ground floor is completed by a separate fourth bedroom with en-suite wet room, useful for those looking for a ground floor bedroom with facilities for perhaps an elderly relative. The first floor has an additional double bedroom and en-suite bathroom.OutsideOne of the main features of this fabulous home are the large rear gardens enjoying a high degree of seclusion and privacy, mainly laid to lawn with a decked area perfect for outdoor entertaining. The property is accessed by a large private driveway with space for several cars, alongside a detached garage and storeroom.For those purchasers looking to extend, subject to usual planning consents, this property offers excellent potential.Local areaSporting and recreational facilities within a short distance are Singing Hills Golf Club near Hurstpierpoint and Hassocks, show jumping at Hickstead, with horseracing available at Plumpton and Brighton. One of the main features of living in this popular hamlet are the incredible countryside walks with the South Downs Link a few minutes away. For those looking for a village pub, The Bull Inn in Henfield is only 0.3 miles away and is a spacious family friendly country pub offering pizza and pasta with a large garden and play area.Close by, Horsham is a thriving historic market town with an excellent selection of national and independent retailers including a large John Lewis at Home and Waitrose store. There are twice weekly award winning local markets in the Carfax in the centre of Horsham to stock up on local produce. East Street, or 'Eat Street' as it is known locally, has a wide choice of restaurants ranging from Pizza Express to the Michelin starred Tristan's. Piries Place in the centre of Horsham is currently undergoing redevelopment to include a new independent three screen cinema, a 92 bed hotel, shops and restaurants. You are spoilt for choice for leisure activities as there is a leisure centre with swimming pool close to Horsham Park whilst the nearby Capitol has a cinema and theatre. There are some beautiful walks and cycle rides in the immediate countryside. Further afield, the stunning South Downs and coast are within easy reach.
listing.short_description: Guide price £700,000 - £740,000 - spacious versatility - This five bedroom detached family home has been refurbished and extended to create flexible accommodation, set in fabulous gardens of over half an acre perfect for entertaining in a pleasant rural location.

listing.description: A superbly refurbished and redeveloped four bedroom, two bathroom detached chalet bungalow located in the sought after village of Jacobs Well.Property DescriptionA comprehensive refurbishment program has included re-wiring, re-plumbing, new roof, new kitchen and bathrooms thus creating a virtual brand new home.The versatile accommodation comprises an impressive open plan kitchen/dining/family room with bi-folding doors to the rear garden, two ground floor bedrooms with access to a ground floor shower room, separate living room and a utility room. Upstairs there are two large double bedrooms and a beautifully appointed bathroom.Other feature include engineered oak wood floors, fully integrated kitchen, double glazed windows, gravel driveway providing off street parking for 5/6 cars and a lawned south facing rear garden.LocationLocated between Woking and Guildford. Guildford is around three miles away with its High Street known within Surrey for its attractive ancient cobbles and pretty shops under the backdrop of the local Downs.Woking town centre is a modern and contemporary town that has been the subject of very significant investment in recent years and in fact continues to be so. The result of this is a busy and thriving centre with a wide and eclectic array of bars, cafes and restaurants as well as a good deal of shopping opportunities not least of which is the Peacocks centre which is also home to the New Victoria theatre and multi screen cinema.Both Woking and Guildford have excellent rail links to London with Woking being the fastest within 25 minutes. The A3 trunk road can be accessed at Burpham around 1.5 miles away and gives a quick link to central London and both Heathrow and Gatwick Airports. There is excellent schooling close by including the newly built Hoe Valley Secondary School is within close proximity.Kitchen

Tenant fee guide


Holding Deposit* - Maximum of 1 weeks rent (per tenancy)
* This fee is non-refundable should you decide not to progress your application or fail to provide your documents within 5 days of paying the holding deposit or sign your tenancy agreement within 15 Calendar days (unless otherwise mutually agreed) or if you have given false/misleading information on the application form or any applicant fails a Right to Rent check. It will be returned to you in the event the landlord is unable to proceed.
Deposit** - 5 weeks Rent
**This is to cover any damages, dilapidations & defaults on the part of the tenant during the tenancy.
During the Tenancy (payable to the Agent)
Payment of interest for the late payment of rent 3% above Bank of England base rate.
During the Tenancy if permitted and applicable
Utilities - gas, electricity, water and sewerage
Communications - telephone and broadband
Installation of cable/satellite/aerial
Subscription to cable/satellite supplier
TV licence
Council Tax
Lost Keys or other Security Devices
Tenants are liable for the actual cost of replacing any lost key(s) or other security device(s). If the loss results in locks needing to be changed, the actual costs of a locksmith, new lock and replacement keys for the tenant, landlord & any other persons requiring keys will be charged to the tenant, If extra costs are incurred there will be a charge of £60 for the time taken replacing any lost keys or security devices.
Variation of Contract (At Tenant's Request and if agreed by Landlord)
£50 (inc VAT) and cover agents reasonable costs in contacting landlord, taking landlord instructions & preparations of new contracts (if required) & system adjustments.
Change of Sharer (At Tenant's Request and if agreed by Landlord)
£50 (inc VAT) per replacement tenancy or any reasonable costs incurred if higher:
To cover the costs associated with taking landlords instructions, new tenant referencing and Right To Rent checks, deposit registration and preparation of new legal documents.
Early release from tenancy
If authorisation is given allowing you to vacate the premises before the expiration of any tenancy agreement, you will be liable for the following:
A - Rent up to the date on which the premises are re-let or the expiration of the tenancy agreement, whichever is the sooner
b - Council tax, water rates, gas and electricity charges along with any other bills which are your responsibility under the tenancy agreement up to the date the premises are re-let, or the expiration of the tenancy agreement, whichever is the sooner
c - There will be a charge, as appropriate, for the landlord's costs for re letting the property
d - These costs will be no more than the maximum amount of rent outstanding
Other permitted payments
Any other permitted payments not included above, for breaches of contract or under the relevant legislation including contractual damages.
Note: Should you report a maintenance issue with the property and a contractor is called out and their investigations reveals the fault has been caused by the tenant/s or an associate of the tenant/s, or no fault exists, cost for this call out will be the responsibility of the tenant/s. Similarly, if a call out is agreed with you and you are not present, contractor call out fee will be your responsibility. Northwood reserve the right to deduct any unpaid monies from the deposit.
Tenant Protection
Northwood Watford Limited is a member of nals which is a client money protection scheme, and also a member of The Property Ombudsman, which is a redress scheme. You can find more details on our website or by contacting us directly.

Once you have found a suitable property you will need to place a holding deposit. This is £300 plus £50 for each additional tenant. If the landlord pulls out of the let you will get this money back. If you pull out of the let or fail our referencing criteria you will not get this money back. This figure is deducted from the monies you pay on move-in.
Agency fees including referencing are :- £150.00 + VAT (£180.00 including VAT) for 1 tenant £250.00 + VAT (£300.00 including VAT) for 2 tenants £350.00 + VAT (£420.00 including VAT) for 3 tenants £450.00 + VAT (£540.00 including VAT) for 4 tenants Rising by £50 plus VAT (£60.00 including VAT) thereafter. On vacating the property a fee of £50.00 +VAT (£60.00 including VAT) per person is charged to cover administration costs, check out Inspection and the provision of references to your new Agent / landlord.
If you are a Student or anyone else requiring a Guarantor then the referencing fees are £180 plus VAT (£216.00 including VAT) as both you and the guarantor are referenced.
Once your / your guarantors forms are approved the move in date can be confirmed.
On move in day you will need to: Pay 6 weeks of the rent as your deposit Pay one months rent in advance Pay for your referencing Each bring in your passport/drivers license as valid photo id We deduct the initial holding deposit at this point. Payment of these charges can be made as follows:
Bankers Draft made payable to knight & knoxley
Cash - £20.00 handling fee applies.
Cheques made payable to knight & knoxley – presented 10 working days before the move in date.
Direct Transfer to our account. Bacs payments take 4 working days, chaps payments to be made no later than 48 hours before move in.
