listing.description: DescriptionCall knight & knoxley For AppointmentsPositioned a in highly sought after residential enclave moments from the burgeoning bar and restaurant scene of Preston Circus and close to Brighton city centre, this exceptional period home offers versatile living accommodation across three floors and a south facing garden.This property has been newly refurbished by current owners to a high standard with beautiful interiors throughout. All sash windows have been fully restored and double glazed throughout the property and a newly fitted kitchen/diner extension is located to the rear of the property.Enter the property into beautifully tiled hallway leading into front facing reception room with original wooden flooring, bay sash window and built in shelving. Stairs lead down to kitchen extension with bi-fold doors leading to south facing garden. Fitted kitchen/ diner space is open plan with plenty of storage, and fitted appliances. South facing garden has been landscaped with decking area which is very private, perfect for sunny summer days.Upstairs to boutique style family bathroom with fitted bath/shower, WC, wash basin and cream tiling through out. Two double bedrooms on this floor with master to the front. Feature fireplaces in each room, high ceilings and light and bright through out. Bay sash window to the front of the master bedroom along with wooden flooring. A further two spacious double bedrooms on the top floor with feature fireplaces and original sash windows.The property is located in a highly sought after area and in the catchment for numerous renowned schools with excellent Ofsted ratings. Brighton beach and the city centre are within easy walking distance and The South Downs National Park with vast open expanses are a short ride away. The property is close to the recently redeveloped Open Market and London Road/Preston Circus area which offer numerous restaurants and a vibrant foodie scene. The famous Brighton Laines & beach are within walking distance. Artist open houses run through the spring months along with summer fairs and street parties in the city and surrounding streets. Looking for an evening out? The Duke Of York's Picture house is one of the best in the UK along with great local pubs serving good food (try The Hare & Hounds, Joker, Open House, Signal Man, Park View, Preston Park Tavern & Jolly Poacher). Excellent local shops serving the best coffee and scrumptious things. Brighton mainline station is moments away with a direct link to Victoria accessible in less than one hour, perfect for commuters. Further good transport links directly to London from both Preston Park and London Road station close by.
listing.short_description: Positioned in a highly sought after residential enclave moments from the burgeoning bar and restaurant scene of Preston Circus and close to Brighton city centre, this exceptional period home offers versatile living accommodation across three floors and a south facing garden.

listing.description: Superb three bedroom converted rural home with huge gardens wrapping around two sides of the property, in fact this is the largest garden on the development.The main living area is an impressive space with high vaulted ceiling and double French doors leading out onto a private terrace - the perfect place to relax and unwind. A luxury kitchen with integrated appliances, master bedroom with en-suite shower room and two further double bedrooms. Bedroom three could also be a useful study and there is a contemporary family bathroom.The rear garden measures approximately a tenth of an acre with a good size decked area, car barn with further parking.Old Park Mews is a bespoke courtyard mews development of just five premium homes converted by Cartwood Builders. All having been individually designed taking in the surrounding countryside and glorious views. The builders have produced a stunning finish blending traditional materials with respect to the rural surroundings.All the kitchens, bathrooms and en-suites are fully fitted with the kitchens having integrated appliances, the bathrooms and en-suites are designed with a contemporary twist. Each property has underfloor heating to the main living areas with hardwood floors and carpets in the bedrooms. The properties have private rear gardens and parking provided via an open car barn and further gated parking. The courtyard is accessed via video entryphone.Rusper is a small country village on the Sussex and Surrey borders. There is community owned village shop, post office, two village pubs, a well regarded primary school, as well as a country hotel, community tennis court and children's play area. There are many rural walks, with the surrounding lanes also perfect for cycling with bridle paths also close by for those who enjoy an equestrian lifestyle. There are many golf courses, including one in Rusper and other forms of recreation nearby. Horsham is approximately four miles distant, having a mainline train station with direct links to London, Brighton and Gatwick.Horsham is a thriving historic market town with an excellent selection of national and independent retailers including a large John Lewis at Home and Waitrose store. There are twice weekly award winning local markets in the Carfax in the centre of Horsham to stock up on local produce. East Street, or 'Eat Street' as it is known locally, has a wide choice of restaurants ranging from Pizza Express to the Michelin starred Tristan's. Piries Place in the centre of Horsham is currently undergoing redevelopment to include a new independent three screen cinema, a 92 bed hotel, shops and restaurants. You are spoilt for choice for leisure activities as there is a leisure centre with swimming pool close to Horsham Park whilst the nearby Capitol has a cinema and theatre.Services are mains electric and water, lpg gas and private drainage.EPC - Awaited.

You are spoilt for choice for leisure activities as there is a leisure centre with swimming pool close to Horsham Park whilst the nearby Capitol has a cinema and theatre.Services are mains electric and water, lpg gas and private drainage.EPC - Awaited.
listing.short_description: Only two homes remaining in this exclusive development - stylish barn - A striking conversion refurbished to exacting standards using traditional materials, including oak beams, feature glass panels, oak staircase and a glass balustrade. A truly stunning space to live in and entertain guests. Three bedrooms, all with en-suite facilities and a stunning living/kitchen space enjoying huge volume. Lovely garden, driveway, car barn and further parking.

listing.description: The property is approached at the front via a gravel driveway, providing off street parking and giving access to the store. Glass sliding doors open into the inner porch and a front door leading into the spacious entrance hall with parquet flooring and access to all reception rooms including the downstairs shower room. The parquet flooring continues through to the dual aspect living room which features an open fire. For more formal entertaining double doors flow through to the adjacent dining room, which can also be accessed off the entrance hall. Further French doors open into the fully glazed conservatory and enjoys panoramic views of the rear gardens. The kitchen has a tiled floor and offers a range of white cabinets with contrasting oak work surfaces. There is space for free standing appliances such as an American style fridge/freezer, dishwasher and an Aga. Further appliances can be plumbed into the separate utility room.The first floor comprises of 5 double bedrooms which are complemented by a bathroom with a corner bath as well as a separate shower room. A 2nd staircase leads to the deceptively spacious second floor which features 2 further rooms that could be used as bedrooms, a study or even a games room.SituationThe property is located in the popular Farnborough Park area and is conveniently situated being within easy reach to the main line station with direct access to London Waterloo within 40 minutes. The area is well known for its excellent local schools and colleges and is nearby to the popular King George V playing fields. Farnborough Town Centre is also nearby which is undergoing a multi million pound redevelopment with a new cinema and a range of restaurants.OutsideThe gravel driveway to the front, provides space for off street parking and the up and over garage door gives access to a store. There is also an area of lawn which is enclosed by mature flower beds and panel fencing as well as a summer house. The westerly facing rear gardens are mainly laid to lawn and are fully enclosed by herbaceous borders, offering a high degree of privacy and seclusion. Ample space in the garden offers numerous areas for additional sheds and greenhouses.

listing.description: An extensive executive home of real substance, The Marlborough creates a first impression that lasts. With five bedrooms - including the impressive 17' x 14' master - and two en-suite bathrooms, there is plenty of room for the whole family. Open plan living and dining areas make spending time together a pleasure, while the cosy snug is ideal for quieter moments of relaxation.Luxury and convenience co-exist harmoniously in The Marlborough, with contemporary appliances and features taking care of all of the needs of modern family life. Yet the architecture is authentically traditional, built with a craftsmanship that many associate with a bygone era.From its traditional, wide bay windows to the spacious integral double garage, The Marlborough is a home that commands attention and evokes pride. Part of our Heritage Collection, it provides a warm welcome to all.About the DevelopmentOn the doorstep of the Chilterns, surrounded by beautiful Buckinghamshire countryside, yet just an hour from London by direct train, Aylesbury has so much to offer for you and your family. Selective education has produced some superb schools in the town, while a £100m redevelopment of the Waterside district has created excellent shopping and leisure for everyone to enjoy.Our new development in Aylesbury is sure to be incredibly popular, with a range of Heritage Collection properties from three to five bedrooms to suit families large and small.Register today and be the first to find out the news and get the pick of the plots when they are released. Remember, with Help to Buy, you need just 5% deposit to secure your Redrow home on our popular development and secure a new life for you and your family.AmenitiesThe development lies close to the town centre giving easy access to a range of supermarkets and convenience stores for your daily and weekly shopping needs.For doctors, register with Broughton House Surgery on Tring Road (Sat Nav HP20 1PH, call while for dentists there is plenty of choice in the town, such as Tavistock House Dental Practice on Tring Road (Sat Nav HP20 1LE, call DiningTrip Advisor lists over 150 places to eat in and around Aylesbury, and you have the choice of high quality international restaurants in the town itself, or delightful country inns in the surrounding villages and hamlets. In Aylesbury, you can choose from all your favourites including Chinese at China Brasserie, Indian at Mela, Golden Bengal or Shensha Balti, Italian at La Salute, Thai at Simply Thai, or wining and dining on a grand scale in the stately surroundings of Hartwell House.Every local village has a pub to discover, with the Five Elms in Weedon, the Seven Stars in Dinton, the Five Arrows in Waddeston and Chequers Inn in Weston Turville all highly recommended.EducationWith Aylesbury operating a selective education system for older pupils, it is vital that your little ones get the best possible start in life. So you'll be delighted to know that the local primaries rate very highly in their Ofsted reports. Bedgrove Infants is rated as an outstanding school, while Broughton Infants is rated good with outstanding pupil behaviour, with both close by to the development.For older pupils, the excellent senior schools of Aylesbury are all within easy reach, including Aylesbury Grammar for boys, Aylesbury High School for girls and Sir Henry Floyd Grammar. The Grange School also offers specialist business and enterprise studies for those who don't get into the grammar schools.LeisureWhatever your interests or activities, you'll find something for you in Aylesbury. The state of the art Aqua Vale offers everything from competition swimming to waves and flumes, while Stoke Mandeville Stadium, birthplace of the paralympics, has a huge range of facilities for all abilities. Golfers can choose from several superb courses in the Buckinghamshire countryside, including Aylesbury Park, Aylesbury Golf Centre and Weston Turville, which is just around the corner from the development.For evening entertainment, head for the Odeon multiplex cinema or the new £42m Aylesbury Waterside Theatre, which is host to a varied programme including touring West End shows. The Queens Park Centre is the uk's largest independent arts centre, and is home to the Limelight Theatre, which hosts an eclectic range of performances.ShoppingAylesbury is an historic market town with hundreds of years of heritage. Today the traditional markets are still held in the Market Square every Wednesday, Friday and Saturday, with a Farmers' market on the last Tuesday of the month and a vintage and craft bazaar held every Tuesday.Friars Square Shopping Centre is the focus for the town, with all your favourite names represented both here and in the surrounding streets. You'll also find a good selection at Hale Leys Shopping Centre, and the Junction and Vale retail parks.The area around Aylesbury Waterside has seen a £100m development in recent years, adding a fascinating range of shops and independent stores along with restaurants and leisure facilities.TransportAylesbury Station has direct connections into the heart of London, with trains to Marylebone taking just an hour and eleven departures between 6am and 8am. There are over 300 parking spaces and over 150 cycle racks at the station.Aylesbury lies on the A41 trunk road, linking London with the North West, with the M1, M40 and M25 all within easy reach. Leighton Buzzard is just 11miles, High Wycombe 15miles, Milton Keynes and Luton are both around 21miles and Oxford is around 25miles. London is easily accessible by road at just 50miles away, and you can get away across the world from Luton Airport, just over 20miles to the east.61

listing.description: Fine and Country are very pleased to offer the opportunity to acquire this quite charming and elegant residence set within the beautiful and picturesque Kentish countryside.A working oast up until the 1950's, the property has in more recent years been extensively and stylishly redeveloped by its current owners and retains huge character, with modern/efficient conveniences such as a thermal hot water system and water softening by Aquasoft. Period features play a consistent theme to include beamed ceilings, open fireplaces and feature ragstone walls.On the ground floor the two roundels have been respectively chosen as a sitting room and TV room, both with French doors opening out onto a wrap around terrace. A large dining room features an exposed brick/ragstone open fireplace, and is in-turn served by a well equipped kitchen. A down stairs cloakroom provides convenience and practicality.A generously sized landing on the first floor affords space for a dedicated study area. The master bedroom, (served by en-suite bath/shower room) is housed within one of the roundels. A large bay window with a bench seat under, overlooks the garden and is a noteworthy feature of the room. A feature fireplace in the second roundel serves as an attractive focal point and one further bedroom with a walk in wardrobe and a family bathroom complete the first floor.The garden provides a stunning, yet low maintenance setting for the home with colour and interest in abundance with all of the benefits of a south easterly aspect. A terrace overlooks a lawn area and a loose ragstone wall to the rear of the garden ties in perfectly with the ragstone walls of the two roundels to the rear elevation of this idyllic home.This area of Kent is renowned for its beautiful villages and countryside, yet is conveniently positioned for a surprisingly short commute to the Capital. A choice of local rail stations is found within a few minutes, with typical journey times to central London being around 1 hour. For those considering continental travel the Channel Tunnel is just 45 minutes away, with the Channel Ferry ports just beyond this. Paris by rail is possible via Ashford International Station in less than two hours, with a myriad of further European journeys available.Educational facilities abound in the area. Local primary schools and secondary schools are found in the nearby villages and a choice of Grammar and private Schools can be found in Maidstone and notably in nearby Sutton Valence.Maidstone, which is Kent's county town, is blessed with a wide array of retail outlets and is regionally accepted as being a hub for commerce and leisure.Entrance  Period wooden stable door with circular window opening toentrance hall  Timber framed windows to side and to sides of entrance door. Beamed ceiling. Fitted Carpet. Radiator.Downstairs cloakroom  Timber framed window to side. Pedestal wash hand basin. Low rise close coupled W.C. Fitted carpet. Radiator.Dining room  Timber framed bay-window to front with additional smaller window. Timber framed bay-window to side. Feature exposed brick and ragstone fireplace with oak mantle over, inset with log burning stove. Beamed ceiling. Ragstone feature wall. Fitted carpet. Radiator.Rear vestibule  Period oak door and timber framed windows to side. Beamed ceiling. Storage cupboard. Fitted carpet. Radiator. Staircase to first floor.Kitchen  Timber framed windows to side. Butler style sink with mixer taps over, inset into a granite work surface. A comprehensive range of eye level, drawer and base units. Tiled splash back. Integrated twin ovens with integral microwave/grill, 5 ring gas hob with extractor over, larder style fridge freezer, dishwasher and washing machine. Breakfast-bar area. Beamed ceiling. Tiled floor. Radiator.Sitting room  Timber framed French doors and windows with plantation shutters to rear terrace. Feature exposed brick, open fireplace with oak bressummer beam over. Beamed ceiling. Fitted carpet. Radiator.TV room  Timber framed French doors and windows with plantation shutters to rear terrace. Feature exposed brick, open fireplace with oak bressummer beam over. Custom made bookcase. Beamed ceiling. Fitted carpet. Radiator.Staircase to first floor  Fitted carpet to stairs. Wooden handrail and balustrade. Exposed beams to walls.Landing  A large landing. Timber framed windows to side. Wooden handrail and balustrade. Dedicated study area with fitted desk, shelve and storage units. Airing cupboard. Access hatch to an insulated loft. Beamed ceiling. Fitted carpet. Radiator.Master bedroom  Timber framed bay window with bench seat under to rear. Bespoke fitted wardrobes and drawers. Fitted carpet. Radiator.En-suite  Timber framed windows to side and rear. Walk-in shower enclosure with a power shower and stainless steel fixtures/fittings. Panelled bathtub. Shelf mount wash hand basin. Low rise W.C. With concealed cistern. Beamed ceiling. Fully tiled walls. Bamboo floor. Radiator/towel rail.Bedroom  Double glazed window to front. Walk-in wardrobe. Beamed ceiling. Fitted carpet. Radiator.Family bathroom  Timber framed window to side. Panelled bathtub with brass antique style mixer taps and separate hand held attachment. Pedestal wash-hand basin. Low rise close coupled W.C. In-built storage cupboard. Beamed ceiling. Tiled walls. Bamboo floor. Radiator.Bedroom  Timber framed window to rear. Feature exposed brick fireplace. Fitted carpet. Radiator.Garden  Access to the wrap around terrace from the sitting room, TV room or by means of a door from the rear vestibule. Steps from the terrace lead down to a lawn area with boundaries consisting of a loose ragstone wall to the rear, a combination of fence and mature shrubbery and specimen trees to the sides. A ragstone retaining wall between the terrace and lawn with beds contain a range of herbaceous plants, shrubs culminating with an ornamental pond. listing.description: This bespoke home has been created from humble beginnings by the current owners, having originally been a 2/3 bedroom detached bungalow this complete redevelopment has created a stunning contemporary low energy property which features many high quality materials that have been internationally sourced.Positioned down a quiet lane within the popular and well serviced village of Great Bentley, the property is within walking distance on Great Bentley train station which offers a direct link to London Liverpool Street. The village of Great Bentley is situated around a large prominent green with a selection of independent local shops, restaurants and other amenities.The Property..Split over two floors the property has been stylishly designed around an open plan kitchen/breakfast/living area which is undoubtedly the hub of the home. Further more on the ground floor there is a spacious lounge, utility room, study/office and shower room. On the first floor, there are four double bedrooms with an en-suite shower room to the master bedroom and a separate family bathroom. Brandon Cottage has been fitted with some exceptional features including; fully fitted fresh air ventilation system which provides clean air throughout the property, Danish triple glazed aluminium windows with timber internals, solid oak doors, brushed concrete flooring and Heatmiser under floor heating throughout the ground floor.Kitchen/Open-planned area..Hacker German kitchen fitted with; floor to ceiling storage units, Dekton marble work surfaces, island unit with a breakfast bar and storage beneath, Neff induction hob inset to work surface with elevating glass extractor, integrated Miele steam and microwave oven, integrated Miele double oven, integrated Miele Nespresso coffee machine, under lights, Blanco taps, Quooker instant hot tap with 100c instant boiling water system with Dekton sink/drainer inset to work surface, integrated Neff fridge/freezer and integrated Neff dishwasher, Danish triple glazed aluminium window with timber internals to side aspect, Heatmiser underfloor heating system, brushed concrete flooring, LED nickel light fittings, chrome usb/plug socketsEntrance Hall..Bushed concrete flooring, Steel staircase with oak treads and a glass banister, brushed concrete flooring.Sitting Room..Spacious and open aspect lounge with polished concrete flooring and underfloor heating with duel aspect windows.Utility Room..Integrated appliances and enclosed Veissman wall mounted boiler with access through to the garageGround Floor Shower Room..Abode double length shower, solid marble wash hand basin, heated towel rail, Heatmiser underfloor heating system, access to the fresh air ventilation system, marble tiles and brushed concrete flooring.Master Bedroom With En-Suite Shower Room..Four velux Danish triple glazed aluminium windows with timber internals (two to each side aspect), vaulted ceilings, Danish aluminium triple glazed doors with Juliet balcony to rear, LED nickel light fittings and a door to the en-suite shower room.Additional Bedrooms..Three further double bedrooms, each fitted with triple glazed danish windows, vaulted ceiling and usb/plug socketsFamily Bathroom..Fully fitted with a whirlpool bath, shower screen and head, low flush Roca toilet, solid granite wash hand basin, obscure Danish aluminium triple glazed window with timber internals and Persian individually distressed wall tiles.Outside..To the front of the property there is a brick/stone laid in-out driveway providing ample off-road parking and in turn leading to the garage which measures 24'4 x 9'11. It has a Hormann electric door, as well as power and lighting connected with triple glazed aluminium Danish patio doors fitted to the rear, providing access onto the garden to allow possible annex potential.The rear garden is mostly laid to lawn and enclosed by a combination of brick built walls and panel fencing. It benefits from a large wooden shed, patio area with Brazilian slate slabs and backs onto large open farmland.Other Information..We understand that the property in connected to mains gas and mains drainage. listing.description: The five bedroom Highgate never ceases to impress, from the initial impact of its classic Arts and Crafts architecture, to the superb specification in every room, all furnished with the finest fixtures and fittings.Set over three floors, the Highgate offers unrivalled luxury and flexibility, with a top floor suite of rooms, including shower room, which can serve a number of uses from home office to teen independence.The middle floor is home to a magnificent master bedroom suite, complete with walk-in dressing room, fitted wardrobes and a top specification en suite, and there are two further doubles and a family bathroom also on this floor.The open plan ground floor is built for the ebb and flow of family life, with a quality fitted kitchen, including top of the range appliances, a separate utility and a spacious dining / family area. The ground floor also has a generous lounge and downstairs cloaks.As practical as it is impressive, the Highgate is a home to be proud of that gives your whole family the luxury lifestyle they deserve.About the DevelopmentOn the doorstep of the Chilterns, surrounded by beautiful Buckinghamshire countryside, yet just an hour from London by direct train, Aylesbury has so much to offer for you and your family. Selective education has produced some superb schools in the town, while a £100m redevelopment of the Waterside district has created excellent shopping and leisure for everyone to enjoy.Our new development in Aylesbury is sure to be incredibly popular, with a range of Heritage Collection properties from three to five bedrooms to suit families large and small.Register today and be the first to find out the news and get the pick of the plots when they are released. Remember, with Help to Buy, you need just 5% deposit to secure your Redrow home on our popular development and secure a new life for you and your family.AmenitiesThe development lies close to the town centre giving easy access to a range of supermarkets and convenience stores for your daily and weekly shopping needs.For doctors, register with Broughton House Surgery on Tring Road (Sat Nav HP20 1PH, call while for dentists there is plenty of choice in the town, such as Tavistock House Dental Practice on Tring Road (Sat Nav HP20 1LE, call DiningTrip Advisor lists over 150 places to eat in and around Aylesbury, and you have the choice of high quality international restaurants in the town itself, or delightful country inns in the surrounding villages and hamlets. In Aylesbury, you can choose from all your favourites including Chinese at China Brasserie, Indian at Mela, Golden Bengal or Shensha Balti, Italian at La Salute, Thai at Simply Thai, or wining and dining on a grand scale in the stately surroundings of Hartwell House.Every local village has a pub to discover, with the Five Elms in Weedon, the Seven Stars in Dinton, the Five Arrows in Waddeston and Chequers Inn in Weston Turville all highly recommended.EducationWith Aylesbury operating a selective education system for older pupils, it is vital that your little ones get the best possible start in life. So you'll be delighted to know that the local primaries rate very highly in their Ofsted reports. Bedgrove Infants is rated as an outstanding school, while Broughton Infants is rated good with outstanding pupil behaviour, with both close by to the development.For older pupils, the excellent senior schools of Aylesbury are all within easy reach, including Aylesbury Grammar for boys, Aylesbury High School for girls and Sir Henry Floyd Grammar. The Grange School also offers specialist business and enterprise studies for those who don't get into the grammar schools.LeisureWhatever your interests or activities, you'll find something for you in Aylesbury. The state of the art Aqua Vale offers everything from competition swimming to waves and flumes, while Stoke Mandeville Stadium, birthplace of the paralympics, has a huge range of facilities for all abilities. Golfers can choose from several superb courses in the Buckinghamshire countryside, including Aylesbury Park, Aylesbury Golf Centre and Weston Turville, which is just around the corner from the development.For evening entertainment, head for the Odeon multiplex cinema or the new £42m Aylesbury Waterside Theatre, which is host to a varied programme including touring West End shows. The Queens Park Centre is the uk's largest independent arts centre, and is home to the Limelight Theatre, which hosts an eclectic range of performances.ShoppingAylesbury is an historic market town with hundreds of years of heritage. Today the traditional markets are still held in the Market Square every Wednesday, Friday and Saturday, with a Farmers' market on the last Tuesday of the month and a vintage and craft bazaar held every Tuesday.Friars Square Shopping Centre is the focus for the town, with all your favourite names represented both here and in the surrounding streets. You'll also find a good selection at Hale Leys Shopping Centre, and the Junction and Vale retail parks.The area around Aylesbury Waterside has seen a £100m development in recent years, adding a fascinating range of shops and independent stores along with restaurants and leisure facilities.TransportAylesbury Station has direct connections into the heart of London, with trains to Marylebone taking just an hour and eleven departures between 6am and 8am. There are over 300 parking spaces and over 150 cycle racks at the station.Aylesbury lies on the A41 trunk road, linking London with the North West, with the M1, M40 and M25 all within easy reach. Leighton Buzzard is just 11miles, High Wycombe 15miles, Milton Keynes and Luton are both around 21miles and Oxford is around 25miles. London is easily accessible by road at just 50miles away, and you can get away across the world from Luton Airport, just over 20miles to the east.99

listing.description: Views of Wellington ParkOne of only 41 townhouses on Royal Arsenal the house offers versatile accommodation over 3 floors and is extremely flexible in terms of use.You could have three double bedrooms and two reception rooms or four double bedrooms and one reception or of course two double bedrooms and 3 receptions - the choice is yours!From the hallway you gain access to the kitchen, downstairs WC and the dining/family room.The kitchen is at the front of the house and as has a good range of cupboards with modern work tops above and built in appliances to include a gas hob with extractor above, electric oven, fridge, freezer, washing machine, dishwasher, so you just need a kettle and away you go!The dining/family room is a good size with wood flooring which runs through from the hallway with glazed doors giving access to the rear garden.The first floor gives access to the main bathroom, one of the double bedrooms which over looks the rear garden and either the living room or 4th bedroom looking out towards Wellington Park, an acre of open space.The second floor brings you to the master bedroom with a ensuite shower and a further double bedroom.The master bedroom is a good size with a built-in wardrobe and space beside it for drawer units or further wardrobe space if needed. There is an ensuite connected.Outside the property has a rear garden with paved patio area leading to the lawn area and there is a driveway to the front of the house to park one vehicle and an option to have a permit to park along the kerbside of Hastings Street as well.These houses are always popular as there are so few of them on the Royal Arsenal Development so please call today to view!Ground Rent Approx: £200Service Charge Approx: £1550Lease: Approx 981 years remainingAll figures are approximate DimensionsGround FloorKitchen: 9ft 9” x 8ft 4” (2.97mx 2.54m)Reception Room: 15ft 2” x 12ft 7” (4.62m x 3.84m)Cloakroom1st FloorBedroom 4/ Living Room: 12ft 11” x 13ft 0” (3.94m x 3.96m)Bedroom 2: 12ft 6” x 8ft 10” (3.81m x 2.69m)Bathroom:2nd FloorMaster Bedroom: 13ft 3” x 12ft 6” (4.04m x 3.81m)Ensuite Shower RoomBedroom 3: 12ft 6” x 8ft 11 (3.81m x 2.72m)Rear GardenParking-Off StreetParking-On StreetTotal Area: 1129sqft - 104.9sqmAll measurements are approximateProperty Hot SpotThe Woolwich Royal Arsenal is one of the most exciting redevelopment and rejuvenation projects in London. The Royal Arsenal has already established a village community that is set to grow and improve beyond recognition. It was a former military barracks, parade ground and munitions storage and factory site dating from 1761 and is built on wide open spaces that have been beautifully landscaped on the banks of the Thames. It already has an established village community with significant commercial/social infrastructure that is set to grow and improve beyond recognition over the next few years once Crossrail is up and running.This is your chance to be part of the next London property hot spot at entry-level prices, allowing you to benefit from great value for money and exciting potential capital gains.Onsite AmenitiesThe Royal Arsenal is a beautiful, private riverside gated development with:24-House Concierge, Parcel Reception and Security.Onsite Parks and Riverwalks Boulangerie Jade - Bakery and Cafe Dry Cleaning ServicesMassage SalonYoung's Brewery Gastro Pubs - The Dial Arch and The GuardhouseFarmers' MarketCar Hire and Electric Vehicle Charging PointsTesco Express, Marks and Spencer's Food and Sainsbury's LocalCon Gusto Italian RestaurantMedical Centre with gp's Surgery and PharmacyPrivate DentistChildren's Nursery and DaycareChildren's Activity CentreThe Taproom Craft Brewery and Pub and Restaurant7R Gym and CrossfitRoyal Arsenal Boot CampsStephen James Car Showroom Travel and Shopping5 to 10 minutes' walk from Woolwich's high street, cafes and market. Royal Arsenal is the perfect place for anyone waiting to trade crowded Central London for space and style while keeping within easy commuting distance.Crossrail Station - Projected opening date - December 2018. The station is on the development and will take circa 10 minutes to Canary Wharf, 15 minutes to Liverpool Street and 25 minutes to Bond Street. It will be direct to Heathrow. By December 2019 it will connect all the way to Reading.Train - 5 minute walk to Woolwich Arsenal Station and 20 to 30 minutes into the city centre - London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross StationsDLR - 5 minute walk to Woolwich Arsenal DLR station and around 25 minutes into London’s Bank Station. Trains run approximately every 4 minutes. Destinations include City Airport 5 minutes, Canary Wharf 19 minutes and Stratford 23 minutes.Tube - North Greenwich station - Jubilee Line is easily accessible by bus and boat, or Canning Town on the DLRBoat - Thames Clippers - The river boat takes you to Canary Wharf in approximately 23 minutes and many stops through to Central London and Waterloo Visit for information and timetable.It's perfect for the 02, Canary Wharf, City and West End. London City Airport is only two stops away by DLR - its close enough for convenience but Royal Arsenal does not have any overhead flights.Future plans for the Royal Arsenal Huge investment is being made on the Royal Arsenal development, including onsite restaurants and wine bars, new retail space, a new hotel, Elizabeth Line Cross Rail Station opening 2018 and the newly announced Dash Arts Cultural Centre, a theatre and arts arena coming in 2019/2020.Regeneration of WoolwichA new Civic Centre on Wellington Street provides a new library, post office and cafe/bar. Behind the centre a brand-new Tesco superstore has recently opened alongside a town centre car park and 1000 new homes. The Tesco store is an eco-store powered by solar panels and wind turbines, and has a farmers' market selling local produce, and two children's playgrounds.At the western end of Powis Street, there is a designated development are known as the Woolwich Triangle - construction will soon commence for a new shopping centre with a major retailer taking centre stage. The Triangle development will include a leisure space, cafes and restaurants. The whole area covers an area of 300,000sqft and will revitalise the whole western end of the Town Centre as a car-free zone. Woolwich gets its own 'West End'. In fact British Land recently spent £100M acquiring land and buildings in Woolwich.The High Street will also benefit from the restoration of the existing Grade II listed buildings to give extra character and focus. The old Co-op building has now been refurbished with more buildings to be done. Once refurbished these historic buildings will accommodate new retail brands and major high street names, the whole area will become more vibrant during the day and in to the evening with new coffee bars and restaurants.£6.6million was recently spent on the redesign of General Gordon Square and Beresford Square near to the Woolwich Arsenal DLR and Train stations. This is now complete, and features include new landscape planting, seating areas, a large digital media display for sporting and public events and a new water feature.Please note: Care is taken in preparing the property details, dimensions and photos, however the accuracy of all the above is in no way guaranteed nor do these details form part of any contract. Prospective purchasers are advised to check all details via their solicitors.

listing.letting_fees:
Once you have found a suitable property you will need to place a holding deposit. This is £300 plus £50 for each additional tenant. If the landlord pulls out of the let you will get this money back. If you pull out of the let or fail our referencing criteria you will not get this money back. This figure is deducted from the monies you pay on move-in.
Agency fees including referencing are :- £150.00 + VAT (£180.00 including VAT) for 1 tenant £250.00 + VAT (£300.00 including VAT) for 2 tenants £350.00 + VAT (£420.00 including VAT) for 3 tenants £450.00 + VAT (£540.00 including VAT) for 4 tenants Rising by £50 plus VAT (£60.00 including VAT) thereafter. On vacating the property a fee of £50.00 +VAT (£60.00 including VAT) per person is charged to cover administration costs, check out Inspection and the provision of references to your new Agent / landlord.
If you are a Student or anyone else requiring a Guarantor then the referencing fees are £180 plus VAT (£216.00 including VAT) as both you and the guarantor are referenced.
Once your / your guarantors forms are approved the move in date can be confirmed.
On move in day you will need to: Pay 6 weeks of the rent as your deposit Pay one months rent in advance Pay for your referencing Each bring in your passport/drivers license as valid photo id We deduct the initial holding deposit at this point. Payment of these charges can be made as follows:
Bankers Draft made payable to knight & knoxley
Cash - £20.00 handling fee applies.
Cheques made payable to knight & knoxley – presented 10 working days before the move in date.
Direct Transfer to our account. Bacs payments take 4 working days, chaps payments to be made no later than 48 hours before move in.
Note that once moved in, a standing order should be set up to pay the monthly rent, and for multi-occupancy properties, the rent should come from one account only. You must put the property address as a reference.
listing.description: DescriptionCall knight & knoxley For AppointmentsSet over three floors, this beautiful Victorian house is the perfect family home offering over 1,400 square feet of versatile living accommodation. Close to local schools, parks and shops, this residential area is also ideal for commuting to London, being 10-15 minutes walk from Brighton station.Enter the property into spacious hallway with original staircase leading to all floors. To the right off the hallway is spacious kitchen/diner with bay sash window to front, wooden flooring and original feature fireplace. The kitchen has butcher block work surfaces and sash window looking out to elevated garden. The front facing reception room has vasts amounts of light flooding the room in the morning to early  the rear of the ground floor is utility area that leads to garden. The garden is separated into four different tiers with playhouse and shed as well as laid to lawn grass area.Upstairs to first floor landing with two storage cupboards and family style bathroom to the back with fitted bath/shower, grey floor tiling, heated towel rack and window allowing light into the room. Up to second landing with first double bedroom with sash window, tall ceilings and wooden flooring. To the front is large reception room with ornate feature fireplace, original cornicings and wooden flooring. Upstairs again to two further bedrooms. Front master bedroom has far reaching views over Brighton and built in storage cupboard.The property is centrally located and conveniently placed for the recently redeveloped Open Market and London Road/Preston Circus area which offer numerous restaurants and a vibrant foodie scene. Roundhill conservation has its own residents society and is a highly popular residential area. The famous Brighton Laines & beach are within walking distance. Fantastic local schools with excellent ofsted ratings (Downs Juniors & Infants moments away). Looking for an evening out? The Duke Of York's Picture house is one of the best in the UK along with great local pubs serving good food (try The Hare & Hounds, Joker, Open House, Signal Man, Park View, Preston Park Tavern & Jolly Poacher). Good local shops (Aldi and Sainsbury's) and the open spaces of the Level within a short stroll away. Brighton mainline station is close with a direct link to Victoria, St Pancras & London Bridge accessible in less than one hour, perfect for commuters. Further good transport links directly to London from London Road station close by.

listing.description: Superbly located within this sought after location is this detached bungalow with the added benefit of having been granted planning permission to redevelop. The property is conveniently located for both Emerson Park and Gidea Park Main Line Railway Stations together with local bus routes and is also within walking distance of local shopping facilities and Haynes Park. In brief, the existing bungalow’s accommodation is accessed via the spacious reception hall which leads to the kitchen/breakfast room 11’10” x 10’11” with separate utility room, lounge 20’10” x 13’5” and study 13’7” x 6’. There are two bedrooms measuring 13’ x 11’11” and 14’3” x 8’5” respectively and a shower room/WC. Throughout the property there is gas central heating via radiators and double glazing. To the front of the property, there is a block paved driveway providing off road car parking for several vehicles. The rear garden is a particular feature and measures approximately 91’ in depth. The vendor has be granted planning permission to fully transform the current property into a detached chalet style house which incorporates four bedrooms and two en suites in addition to a family bathroom/WC to the first floor. The ground floor accommodation would incorporate three reception rooms, an open plan kitchen/family room with separate utility, ground floor WC and an attached garage. Full plans can be provided for further details. We cannot over emphasize the need for a personal inspection to fully appreciate the potential offered. Ref No. 4939-19. EPC E.

listing.description: Property description  Enjoying an elevated setting overlooking the Stour Valley with unrivalled views of a picturesque medieval village, a three bedroom art deco bungalow set within established grounds of approximately 0.92 acres. Situated at the end of a private driveway with no immediate neighbours, the property has retained many hallmarks and features associated with a property of this ilk and style including bay windows, picture rails, 1920's style fireplaces, original doors with glazing above and stripped pine flooring. Offering a unique aspect from every room, the property also offers considerable scope for extension or redevelopment (subject to the necessary planning consents). Further benefits to the property include a detached garage, ample private parking and a truly outstanding situation in one of the area's most highly regarded villages.  Timbered door with leaded light glazing opening to:Entrance porch:  With quarry styled terracotta tiled flooring throughout, clouded panel door opening to:Inner hall:  11' 10" x 5' 10" (3.63m x 1.80m)  With stripped pine flooring throughout, picture rails and 9ft ceiling. Door to:Sitting room:  15' 1" x 11' 9" (4.61m x 3.59m)  Enjoying a dual south-westerly aspect with Oriel bay window to side and further bay window to front affording elevated views over the surrounding period rooftops and Stour Valley distant. Central wood burning stove within a slate fireplace, wooden surround and mantle over.Dining room:  14' 0" x 12' 9" (4.28m x 3.89m)  With six bay window to front affording an open westerly aspect over the valley distant, central fireplace with tiled hearth, wooden surround and carved mantle over. Useful recesses either side of the fireplace, deep skirting and picture rail.Kitchen:  16' 9" x 9' 0" (5.12m x 2.75m) and 10' 6" x 7' 1" (3.22m x 2.18m)  An l-shaped room fitted with a matching range of low maintenance, soft-close units with worktops over and tiling above. Stainless steel single sink unit with mixer tap over and window to side. Three door Rangemaster oven set within a tiled recess with extraction above. Fitted pine corner unit provides additional storage and space for fridge/freezer and dishwasher. Door to storeroom with deep shelving and further door to boiler room housing gas-fired boiler with useful fitted shelving. The kitchen further benefits from door to side terrace and further door to rear.Breakfast room:  12' 10" x 9' 0" (3.92m x 2.76m)  With window to side overlooking gardens, stripped pine flooring throughout and picture rail. Range of part glass fronted recessed storage units.Master bedroom:  13' 1" x 12' 5" (3.99m x 3.79m)  With windows to side and rear, stripped pine flooring throughout and pedestal wash hand basin to corner.Bedroom 2:  12' 7" x 12' 0" (3.84m x 3.67m)  With windows to front and side, original fireplace and stripped flooring throughout.Bedroom 3:  9' 6" x 7' 0" (2.92m x 2.14m)  With window to rear.Family bathroom:  9' 6" x 9' 2" (2.90m x 2.81m)  Principally tiled and fitted with corner WC, pedestal wash hand basin, bidet, bath with shower attachment over, fully tiled separately screened shower unit with shower attachment over and clouded glazed windows to rear.Outside  Discretely situated at the end of a private driveway, this hidden gem is understood to have been constructed by the locally renowned Deaves family. Nestled within diverse grounds of approximately 0.92 acres, gardens have been developed and landscaped over many years to incorporate a range of seating areas, diverse border plants, mature hedging, established trees and a raised vegetable garden. A paved terrace lies on the site of a former swimming pool with the gardens themselves undulating gently towards Sudbury Road and defined by a hedged border. The approach road sweeps into a widened area providing off-street parking for in excess of five vehicles with direct access provided to:Garage:  17' 5" x 15' 10" (5.31m x 4.83m)  With up-and-over door to front.Garden  To the rear of the property are a range of versatile outbuildings providing scope for improvement or adaption into annexe/ancillary accommodation (subject to the necessary planning consents) comprising guest room/occasional bedroom, storeroom, shower room and workshop.Agents note:  An overage clause is in place entitling the current owners of the property to a 10% uplift should planning permission be obtained for any further residential dwellings within the 20 year period from 2018.Services:  Mains water, drainage and electricity are connected. Gas fired heating to radiators. Note: None of these services have been tested by the agent.

listing.description: A rarely available, two double bedroom, two bathroom modern house with off street parking, located within a gated development just 0.5 miles (10 minute walk) from the railway station and offered with no onward chain. This stylish terrace mews forms part of the luxurious redevelopment of the former Police Federation headquarters by the Sunley Group and completed in 2014. The property itself has been finished to the highest specification and comprises a reception room and separate kitchen/dining room, which in turn spills out onto a private garden. A downstairs W.C. Is also provided whilst the first floor offers two double bedroom and two stylish modern bathrooms, one of whichi is en suite. Off street parking is also provided to the front of the house. Langley Road is a residential street just north of Surbiton town centre and lined with mature, established trees. It is within a short walk of the town centre whilst its mainline railway station offers connections into London Waterloo in as little as 17 minutes. Access to the A3 is also convenient offering alternative routes into and out of London.

listing.description: We are pleased to present this stunning two-bedroom warehouse conversion, situated within the historic former Spratts factory complex. The apartment is located in Colmans Wharf which is one of four converted buildings in the highly sort after secure gated development.During the early part of the 20th century, Spratts was the world’s largest pet food producer. The factory was converted into live-work units in 1985 becoming one of the first warehouse conversions in London. Due to the individuality of each apartment, it has been home to many creative people during this period.There is 1050 sq. Ft approx. Of internal space, on two levels and comprises; two double bedrooms with built-in storage, a modern bathroom with underfloor heating and an expansive open-plan kitchen and reception area. Noteworthy features include exposed brickwork, iron beams and high ceilings. The original wrought iron spiral staircase leads to a mezzanine area. The property also benefits from an allocated parking space.The apartment is situated on the Limehouse Cut Canal in a vibrant area undergoing major redevelopment. Within ten minutes’ walk are Chrisp Street Market and the recently renovated Grade-ii listed Poplar Baths & leisure centre. There are lots of local parks and green spaces in the area with Mile End and Victoria Park a short walk away.Morris Road is located within 0.3 miles approx. Of Langdon Park DLR station allowing access to Canary Wharf and all its amenities. Devons Road Station (DLR) and Bromley – By – Bow Underground (District, Hammersmith & City Line) are also within very close proximity, assuring a quick and easy journey direct in to Canary Wharf, the City and Stratford Westfield (Jubilee and Crossrail).To fully appreciate this Share of Freehold property with no ongoing chain, please call now to arrange a viewing, alternatively you can reach us via email at .

listing.description: Set back from the road and enjoying a quiet and secluded spot is this four bedroom, two bathroom, detached bungalow. With an individually designed kitchen and dining area, a south west facing rear garden as well as ample parking and two garages, this family property is located just over half a mile to the newly redeveloped Addlestone One town centre and even closer to local shops and schools.The main living area is an impressive sized lounge with a feature fireplace and large patio doors leading to the rear garden. The lounge also leads to the conservatory which could easily double up as a children's play room, media room or as an area to relax and unwind at the end of the day. The bespoke kitchen has a range of built in storage, work tops and appliances including a double oven and hob as well as having space and plumbing for white goods. The adjoining dining area has patio doors and dual aspect views of the garden.Three of the four bedrooms are double in size with the master bedroom having its own en-suite shower room and French doors to the garden. The three remaining bedrooms are serviced by the four piece family bathroom with separate shower. Bedroom four is currently used as a home office.To the front there is off road parking for several cars, two single garages assist with parking and storage while the rear garden is on two sides of the bungalow and faces both south and west.
